qas.question: What are traditional pub windows made out of?
What are the windows of 1990s and later pubs often made of?
Aside from beverages, what types of food do pubs typically offer?

context: Historically, pubs have been socially and culturally distinct from cafés, bars and German beer halls. Most pubs offer a range of beers, wines, spirits, and soft drinks and <a2_0>snacks<a2_0/>. Traditionally the windows of town pubs were of <a0_0>smoked or frosted glass<a0_0/> to obscure the clientele from the street but from the 1990s onwards, there has been a move towards <a1_0>clear glass<a1_0/>, in keeping with brighter interiors.
